goal:
ANIA, the Italian insurance association, was established in 1944. It is the representative body for mutual, cooperative and joint-stock insurance and reinsurance companies in Italy. It covers 81% of the Italian insurance market. The main objectives of ANIA are:
- to negotiate collective agreements with trade unions and to promote initiatives aimed at encouraging professional training;
- to carry out studies in order to solve problems dealing with techical, economic, financial and legislative matters and to perform information, advisory and assistance activities for members.
interests: Banking and financial services, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Competition, Consumers, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, Environment, External Relations, Institutional affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives:
Si elencano di seguito alcune fra le principali tematiche seguite attualmente da ANIA:

- Motor Insurance Directive;
- Sustainable Finance;
- Capital Market Union (CMU);
- InsurTech;
- Solvency II review;
- PRIIPs;
- IFRS 17;
- Private Pension European Product (PEPP).
